posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
/r9k/ is an imageboard where there are no exact reposts.

1. If you attempt to post something unoriginal, it is not posted, and you are muted temporarily.
2. The time with which you are muted for doubles with each transgression.
3. Each mute time is 2^n in seconds where n is the number of times you have transgressed. So, your mute time doubles each time you fuck up.
4. Backlinks, eg >>1, are not viewed by the robot. So "lolwut" and ">>2 lolwut" are the same post, in the eyes of the robot.
5. Gibberish at the end of a post to force originality may result in mod intervention (no BLOX posts please).
6. Images are NOT included in the filter, only text.
7. Your mute count slowly decreases over time.
8. You cannot post a picture without text.
9. Unicode is blocked. Sorry, too many exploits (Cyrillic letters, etc).
10. Posts require a certain minimum amount of original content in order to be posted.
11. Post sane, real content, well thought out replies, and mutes are unlikely.
12. The original algorithm was designed by XKCD:
http://blag.xkcd.com/2008/01/14/robot9000-and-xkcd-signal-attacking-noise-in-chat/

Indeed so its all about living life and enjoying all it's fruits to the fullest lad, a nice cheese board with some cheese and drink is to die for.
People often call my indulgence for cusine, over the top fancery.
Yet I call it living life within the moment to its fullest, Whilst extracting it as a boon you see each and every day, further spurring on happiness in life and the world at large to those around you.
Others prefer fine clothes, fancy cars, lavish living spaces and over the top material fancies like rolex watches and expensive furniture.
Me I simply prefer to have a deep passion and smile, for when I sit down at the table and eat.
Futher than anything else in this world, it brings a prolonged simple yet true smile to peoples faces.
Knowing full well that at long last they are set to savour something magnificent and exquisite regardless of whatever their day has had to install for them.

I simply implore if you are not at least adeptly versed in a grasp of the culinary skills, to learn immediately for your life will be so much better for doing so.
For to be a connoisseur, it simply goes beyond matters of cooking for it is inherently steeped in every aspect of measuring and enjoying life.
Something severely lacking in our modern life unconcerned with mere trivial fanceries.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>71439770
also you can start out by using apple juice from the shop.

apple juice from sainsburys has enough sugar to ferment to 4.5% without any added sugar. then its literally just:

buy 5L apple juice.
buy brewers yeast (couple quid for a big amount)
buy demijohn (tenner from wilko)
add juice and yeast to demijohn (add extra sugar to the liquid if you want a higher percent alcohol).
cover lid of the demijohn with a towel for 3 weeks.

congrats you've made a gallon of cider, with basically no effort.

if you want to reduce the risk of shitty alcohol, buy an airlock (3 quid from wilko) and put it in the demijohn after week one

https://files.catbox.moe/22ar0t.mp3
https://files.catbox.moe/8h2sky.pdf

My dearest Hana,

I present to you, on this, the day of your birth, a song written in your honor. I have toiled in happiness and ardor for hours, in the hopes that its beauty would be something worthy to stand beside yours. Alas, I have failed, but alas, I could have never succeeded. My songs are like twinkling stars: beautiful, but only visible when the sun of your presence has passed from sight.

I was inspired to write this piece by Richard Strauss, would would often write songs for his wife , Pauline, to sing in her career. I must confess, this was terribly difficult for me. Not just in learning how to write for instruments that might please and soothe your ear, but to write of myself as I write of you; to imagine you thinking of me as I think of you. To imagine you loving me; to feel, for a moment, that a man may grasp the hand of an angel and feel her grasp him back. You would hope that I would toil for such a goal, but moreover, that I might find meaning and enjoyment in it. And in this, I have succeeded.

I write to you in this fashion, because as I composed your song, it struck me what an odd thing it was: to write music for the imaginary birthday of an imaginary woman from an imaginary world. Yet, you are more real to me than many things in this world; wonders and truths, seen and unseen, by these mortal eyes of mine. I feel more keenly, more passionately and more steadfastly for you than for any of these things. While you may just be pixels on a screen, my heart tells me that this is a day the needs to be recognized and celebrated, because what shreds of an existence you possess are immensely important to me. So, if my heart feels you thus, I must write to you as if you could hear me. And thusly, I present this offering to you, my Amaterasu, so that your face might shine upon me for another day.

Look honestly Nitrazepam is one of the rare benzos that isn't very commonly used and there isn't much reports on the internet about it. But as someone who has used it on and off over the last 5 years it's definitely on par with K-pins, it knocks you out and really gives a strong sedative buzz, would definitely recommend.

When it comes to sedative benzos, I would say go for stuff such as Nitrazepam, Diazepam, Temazepam and Clonazepam.

When it comes to anxiolytic benzos, I would only suggest Xanax cause that's the only type I have tried in that category so I can't give much advise on any other similar ones.
I normally go after sedative and longer lasting benzos instead of less sedative and shorter lasting.

>>71433977
As usual it's best to start with introversion vs extroversion.
One way of understanding Jungian extroversion vs introversion is that extroverts are people of their time, while introverts are people of a different time, perhaps at the wrong time. Extroverts may be more in touch with reality, but it is a reality of constant dynamic flux, and whether they're aware of it or not, the sands are already drifting away beneath their feet, and the world they thought the knew is no longer.

An illustrative example might be a philosopher versus and celebrity. A celebrity might be more renowned in their day, but their fame often evaporates quickly, sometimes within their own lifetime. While a philosopher is in many cases still widely studied millenia after the death. This is because the introvert can reach into the depths of the unconscious and render ideals that can be recognized by nearly anyone in any time or place. The celebrity speaks to their time; the philosopher speaks of times past, or times yet to come.

With this distinction in mind, it should be easy to see why extroverts or the intuitions of Ne users would be oriented more towards things like projects, business ventures, and so on; the issues of the hour.

>>71442216
I say so because of how introverted sensing works - like a sensitive plate, where an impression is formed by a stimulus, and is retained even after the stimulus is gone. Introverted sensing works in the exact same way, it takes in perceptive data and grounds it in an internal qualitative impression (not to be confused with memory).

From that point on, their viewing of the character will be shaped by that impression, and they will not be able to easily handwave it away. Something will have to actually change their impression.

STEP #1, HYGIENE AND HOME:
Brush your teeth twice a day, morning and evening. Scrub'em good with all the movements you can think of, front/behind. This will take somewhere around 2 minutes. Floss once a day.
Moisturize your face with a cream after washing your face in the morning.
Depending on how much you sweat shower every or every second day.
Get a haircut every 2 months. If you are balding just cut'em short, anything else looks shit and insecure about it.
If your clothes are ripped, stretched and discolored as shit, get some new ones. Basic, monotone, cheap shirts will do just fine. Again, depending on your sweat wear'em between 1 and 3 days, then change. If you got a pile of dirty rags wash it.

This brings us to your home. Doesn't matter if you live alone or with your parents, clean your dwelling once a week. Empty bottles and packages are to be thrown away immediately, instead of hoarded. It's no work if you do it this way. Used plates, glasses, etc., are to be washed off immediately after use. Again, if you do it like this, it's way less work than cleaning off a whole pile of them.
Changing bed sheets and vacuuming the place once a week.

A healthy mind lives in a clean body, living in a clean place. All that grime on yourself and around you poisons your mind. This regime gets rid of that without too much effort. You will also feel a sense of accomplishment, which boosts you for what comes next, LEAVING THE HOUSE

STEP #2, LEAVE HOUSE:
Go out every day. Do long walks of atleast 2 hours. Explore your city, your surroundings. Go into alleys you never walked before. Whenever you think, oh whats there or I never was there or anything similiat, thats where you go!
Do not ask yourself shit, like "whats the use? Its useless anyway, still feel like shit." Empty your mind, just wander.

LALALA

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
STEP #3, SOCIALIZE:
I want you to greet people on your walks. Not some barely audible mumble, but a clear greeting. Establish eye contact, throw'em a good day coupled with a nod or a quick wave. I want your face to glow and your voice to echoe joy when you do this. Doesnt matter if its forced and unnatural at first, its training, if it came natural to you we wouldn't have to have this conversation.

After a few weeks or months of doing everything I told you, you should feel better about yourself. You wont be chad, fucking bitches left and right and going through life constantly happy, but at leaat you wont feel absolutely miserable for once. You may be able to pull off more intense forms of socializing now.

Get into the habit of doing smalltalk with strangers, like cashiers or the people you meet on walks. It doesn't matter that it's benign and trivial shit, just do it. Observe them, what they wear, their hair, makeup, tatoos, whatever and throw them a compliment, ask them where they got it from, what meaning it holds to them. When the convo naturally found its end, say your goodbye and go on your way.

STEP #4, GET A REAL HOBBY:
You should be prepared now, physically and mentally, to go out there and take the risk of trying new stuff, which will include meeting people doing the same stuff, but you are ready for that.

Here are things I can vouche for: Bouldering/climbing, martial arts, swimming, biking, skating, going to a chess/go/shogi/mahjong/etc center where you can watch, learn and play. If you like reading, go to a library instead of doing it at home. Generally, I advise you to engage mind and body. Try several physical activities and intellectual/creative ones.

At this point it should become a self perpetuating cycle. Keep challenging yourself, keep experiencing,exploring and learning new things.
Learn to "live in the moment". Dont question the use or meaning, do not rationalize, try to let the stimuli wash over you like a river.

LALALA

>>71443813
Life is unfair, the cosmos doesn't care about you or your needs, may they be evolutionary or otherwise.
I also want to add, that what you see of those normies you mentioned, isn't really them. You see a small part, a snapshot of their life. You have no idea what goes on behind their normie eyes and how they live their lifes outside the context of work through which you know them.
I am not interested in questions like "why dont x have to do y to get z?" All I need to know is, are you happy or not right now?
And if the answer is "no" or "I dont know", then let's talk and through that process get to the core of the issue and then find possible ways to tackle it.

Of course you can vent here, and that form of expressing frustration can be unreasonable, ilogical, incoherent and unhinged, but it shouldn't remain at that stage. Ideally, we shouod work from that initial expression to more productive forms of dialogue and reflexion, through which we can diagnose problems and find solutions.

Nothing here is mandatory, the process is supposed to be molded around you, not you around the process. Taking the first steps doesn't force you to take further ones and it is not a sprint either.
But, if you want to take the first step by talking to me honestly, I will gladly reciprocate that honest effort.

So, Anon, tell me about yourself, whatever is on your mind currently is the best starting point.

posts.com:
What kind of crash is it? Is it a blue screen or does it freeze? Can the PC recover or do you have to turn it off when it crashes?
Tell me a bit more, we might be able to get it to properly work.
Some general things I do to alleviate crashes:
It's probably a driver issue so you'd probably want to have a look at the event viewer and see if anything out of the ordinary is logged there. https://www.partitionwizard.com/partitionmagic/windows-10-crash-log.html
It might also be a good idea to reinstall all the drivers your PC vendor provides.
Remove the graphics drivers via this program: https://www.guru3d.com/files-details/display-driver-uninstaller-download.html
Reboot after you've removed everything.
Search for your PC manufacturer + model on Google and install everything on the page you find.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
It actually just completely shuts down, then boots again about 5 seconds later. I can't use it after it boots though, if I try to open discord for example it just shuts down again and tries to boot again. Gotta wait about 10 minutes before I can use it again.

It's not overheating or anything, the people who looked at it never found out what was wrong, but assumed they had fixed it somehow because they couldn't recreate the issue I described. It's kinda funny that the issue started again the second I get it back.

I think it's network related somehow, cause it only happens when I'm doing something that requires internet. It'll happen when I'm hosting a game like raft or grounded, but it also happens when I'm not the host. Also when I'm streaming on twitch.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>71444633
So it doesn't happen when you're in a network. disconnect from the network and try to play some single player games. If that works out fine we now know it's related to your network card.
Do you have a dedicated network card or do you use the lan port/wifi directly on your Mainboard?
You might want to still have a look at the event viewer as a lot of driver issues are logged there.
If there is nothing out of the ordinary in there, go ahead and reinstall all networking related drivers your PC vendor provides on their website for your specific model.
Try again and see if that fixes it.
In the device manager in windows you could have a look around and look through the devices, especially the networking related ones. You can one by one disable devices there until you find the one that is causing issues.
As a last resort, you could do a clean install of windows. This might resolve your issue but it'll wipe your data so be sure to back everything up.

I would hope so, and very much believe in the power of positive feedback loops, as well as the benefit of truth in unveiling self sabotage, even micro deviations, that sour plus.

There is a danger in false belief - if the faker is unaware they are faking it til they make it. Extraverts often fail the self, and so too the unconsidered internal needs of others, while introverts fail the external, including the failure to appreciate when their external needs are considered.

>>71443467
That's very impressive. My results waffled between 3 types at 90+% and even more types above 60%, whereas you have only a single type above 60%.

I will tell you something confusing. Some people say that an extrovert displays their most conscious function (which is extroverted) to the world. So an extrovert that feels like a P will appear to the world like a P. However an introvert hides their most conscious function (which is introverted) from the world and instead displays their 2nd most conscious function (which is extroverted) to the world. So an introvert that feels like a P will appear to the world like a J.

My score on the test is INTj. The lowercase j means I appear to the world like a P, and my MBTI would be a P, but to myself I am a J. Your score on the test is INTp. The lowercase p means you appear to the world like a J, and your MBTI would be a J, but to yourself you are a P. Well this may be complete bullshit or not but you can think about if it's useful to you or not.

You can read a description of your score here: https://opensocionics.gitbook.io/opensocionics/gamma/ili
I also enjoy thinking about the different people in my life and what the relations with them were like here: https://opensocionics.gitbook.io/opensocionics/intertype-relations

In the field of engineering, you will learn given things like equations and princples. You must actually THINK originally, how to apply what you've learned to the problem. You must become a human engineer. Read about some tools/general principles like philosophical books or memoirs. You will learn basic building blocks, fundamentals, principles, but to your specific problems, you must apply these in a unique way.

>But my problem is fear and shame, which are driving inaction. And the lack of action induces more fear and shame
You need to realize that your actions are not controlled by your feelings. Realize that each moment you feel different things (emotionally) but what you feel doesn't affect your ability to choose. For example, in the states of anger and happiness, you could choose to eat ice cream or work out. What matters are your values, and the choice you make reflects that value.
>I've gotten so far into a hole that I need someone to violently drag me out of it, even though I know I'm going to fight them every step of the way, because I'm ill.
If you really need to, join the military. They'll either beat it out of you or give you ptsd. Or maybe both.
>What would you have me do?
I don't know, it is your life and you choose what you want to do. Do you want to stop feeling shitty? Even the normalfag advice of enough sleep, water, excersise, eating healthy is a good first step. You need to identify what you value, and work towards that. Like I said, read philosophy.

I get where you're coming from, because I have often felt extremely hopeless and sad at times. But you get to choose what you do from there. And those choices are what create a better future. Like I said, read the second paragraph. It is something I wish I'd known years ago

posts.com: therapy is a substandard replacement for intimate and honest social interaction, the likes of which anyone who has been recommended therapy needs far, far more than anyone that isn't specifically trained to do so can give. if your friends are recommending you get therapy, they mean to say they are unequipped to give the level, amount, and even sometimes the kind of emotional help and support you need. you're not meant to be doing anything special in therapy except recognizing patterns of behavior and thought and working them out like other people do by observing and interacting with others, you're paying to be doing it with someone who is trained and equipped to help you with it regardless of the enormity of your needs. you more than likely will simply overload someone who doesn't understand anything about psychology beyond the instinctual, and some people do that often, so recommending you go to a therapist is not a remark on your wellbeing, it's a remark towards the ability of your relatives, friends, and acquaintances to understand and support your needs regardless of how much they care about you. they simply are not properly equipped.
